climbs.name: Touch and Go
climbs.fa: Mark Rafferty &a Brandon Emery, May 24 2018, ground up

content.description: Start off by side pulling up until you stand in a small pod. Placing small gear reach up onto the fin and make your way into a thin hand crack. Bring a large sling to belay off the summit. Rappel down Loose Cannon.
content.location: This climbs about 3 feet to the left of Loose Cannon on the west face.

content.description:
This is one route that demands some sporty technique down low but makes this route short and sweet.

 Start off by standing on top of a small ledge and makes your first move into the arete. Clip the first bolt and alternate between heel and toe hooks up past the second bolt leading into the finger crack. Transfer left into the right leaning finger crack (crux) and jam up and through finishing on the arete.
content.protection: Small finger sized gear, 2 bolts    Bolted anchor
content.location: Loose Cannon climbs the obvious bald looking arete on the south side of the formation.

content.description: A thin tiny pinnacle that stands about 50 ft tall. Named after a famous pirate ship, this formation mimics a sail like feature. There are two routes on this formation that require some smaller sized gear. If in the Main Wall Area this is a nice spot to climb.
